characters.name: Athena Cykes
characters.description1: A new lawyer at my agency. She studied psychology while she was in Europe.

characters.name: Apollo Justice
characters.description1: An ardent young lawyer in my agency. His special feature is his very loud voice.

characters.name: Trucy Wright
characters.description1: My daughter, who also happens to be an aspiring magician. I adopted her eight years ago.

characters.name: Sasha Buckler
characters.description1: An orca trainer and performer in the Swashbuckler Spectacular. She appears to be best friends with Orla.

characters.name: Bobby Fulbright
characters.description1: The detective assigned to this case. He sure makes a lot of noise, but he appears to be on the side of justice.

characters.name: Ora Shipley
characters.description1: The orca accused of murder. Though "Ora" is her real name, people like to call her "Orla". She likes to wear hats.
characters.description2: An orca nicknamed Orla. She has a wound on her head, and luminol revealed traces of blood on her body.

characters.name: Jack Shipley
characters.description1: The owner of Shipshape Aquarium. He was found dead in the orca pool.

characters.name: Norma DePlume
characters.description1: An aquarium visitor. She seems to know something about what happened.
characters.description2: The aquarium visitor who saw Orla attack the aquarium owner. It turns out she's a nonfiction writer.

characters.name: Marlon Rimes
characters.description1: Shipshape Aquarium's new animal keeper. He loves animals as much as he loves rapping.

characters.name: Rifle
characters.description1: A penguin that always shoots straight at her mark. She seems to love the smell of fish.
characters.description2: A penguin, not a deadly weapon! The bottoms of her flippers are stained pink, and a good luck charm was found in her stomach.

characters.name: Pearl Fey
characters.description1: A spirit medium in training. Her psychic powers are beyond question.

characters.name: Simon Blackquill
characters.description1: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.

characters.name: Herman Crab
characters.description1: Shipshape Aquarium's resident vet. A baby penguin lives in his hair.

characters.name: Azura Summers
characters.description1: The trainer who preceded Sasha. She died during a show on July 20th last year.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

evidences.name: Swashbuckler Flyer
evidences.description1: An advertisement showing an orca dressed up like a pirate. It was dropped by a penguin.
evidences.description2: An advertisement for a new show. It was dropped by a penguin.
evidences.description3: An advertisement for a new show. It appears that Sasha was not slated to return.

evidences.name: Photo of the Body
evidences.description1: A crime scene photo taken in the orca pool room. It's hard to make out details of the body.
evidences.description2: Crime scene photos taken in the orca pool room. (2 photos.)

evidences.name: Orca Pool Diagram
evidences.description1: A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. The pool is about 65 feet deep.
evidences.description2: A cross-section view of the 1st- and 2nd-floor sections of the orca pool. Pearls apparently entered the staff corridor.
evidences.description3: It also has information about the area around the orca pool on the first and second floor. The pool is about 65 feet deep.

evidences.name: Whistle
evidences.description1: A whistle for issuing instructions to Orla. Anyone can use one to command her, as long as they know the right signals.
evidences.description2: Orla performs one trick per signal. She can't do two at a time.

evidences.name: Security Footage
evidences.description1: Video showing the orca pool from the visitor's corridor. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time.
evidences.description2: Video showing the orca pool. The footage starts at the aquarium's 10 AM opening time. (2 pages.)

evidences.name: Fish
evidences.description1: A large quantity of fish for feeding Rifle the penguin. Not surprisingly, it has a horribly fishy smell!

evidences.name: Walkie-Talkie
evidences.description1: Issued to all aquarium staff for communication. It can apparently also be used to broadcast inside the aquarium.

evidences.name: Calendar
evidences.description1: A penguin-shaped calendar that Pearls bought at the aquarium. It smells fishy for some reason.
evidences.description2: Apparently belongs to Rimes. It was accidently [sic] switched with Pearls's calendar around 10:10 AM.
evidences.description3: Apparently belongs to Sasha. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th.
evidences.description4: It turns out this doesn't belong to Sasha. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th.
evidences.description5: A calendar that Azura Summers gave to Dr. Crab. A meeting with the victim was scheduled for 7 AM on the 20th.

evidences.name: Bloodstained Coin
evidences.description1: A single coin seems to have fallen by the side of the orca pool.
evidences.description2: Discovered by the side of the orca pool. There are 300 coins in all, weighing 7 pounds total. This makes it a likely murder weapon.

evidences.name: Swashbuckler Video
evidences.description1: A TV recording of a performance featuring Orla, Sasha and Jack Shipley as pirates.
evidences.description2: The show song on the video is different from the one DePlume heard.

evidences.name: TV Phone
evidences.description1: A cell phone used by Shipshape Aquarium staff. This model can connect to TVs and be used to conduct teleconferencing.
evidences.description2: Summers's boyfriend has videos of her using a whistle to make the orca do tricks.
evidences.description3: A cell phone used by Shipshape Aquarium staff. Videos of Summers can be viewed. (2 pages.)

evidences.name: Shipley's Autopsy Report → Shipley's Data
evidences.description1: Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body.
evidences.description2: Instant death from a brain contusion. There are signs of blunt force trauma all over the body. Details updated.
evidences.description3: Shipley's walkie-talkie hasn't been found. (3 pages.)

evidences.name: "The Killer Killer Whale"
evidences.description1: A nonfiction book by Norma DePlume. It's about the case from last year.

evidences.name: Security Card
evidences.description1: A key card for gaining access to the orca pool. Only the victim and Sasha had one.

evidences.name: Prescription Bag
evidences.description1: Seized from Sasha's residence. She apparently had this filled at the Hickfield Clinic.

evidences.name: Skull Rock
evidences.description1: There's a bloodstain on the rock. The victim may have struck it when he fell to his death.
evidences.description2: A new show prop that was at the orca pool. The victim struck it when he fell.
evidences.description3: Moved from the show pool during cleaning time. The victim struck it when he fell to his death.
evidences.description4: The victim slammed into it when he fell. Orla also rammed into it. It had been moved from the show pool.

evidences.name: Pool Bottom Photo
evidences.description1: A photo of the bottom of the pool. The locations of the bloodstains detected with luminol are sketched in.

evidences.name: Mysterious Capsule → "3 Zs" Sleeping Pill
evidences.description1: The strange capsule that was found in Orla's stomach. "3 Zs" is printed on it.
evidences.description2: The strange capsule that was found in Orla's stomach. It's a sleeping pill, not some kind of poison.

evidences.name: Handmade Sign
evidences.description1: A sign Sasha made for the new show. It's been left to dry since the early hours of the 20th.

evidences.name: Ladder Prints
evidences.description1: The fingerprints discovered by Pearls at the show stage. They're Rimes's, but there's something odd about them.

evidences.name: Charm
evidences.description1: Discovered in Rifle's stomach. It might belong to Azura Summers's boyfriend.

evidences.name: TORPEDO Data
evidences.description1: TORPEDO data shows that Rifle ate around 4:00 AM on July 20th, but that Orla didn't eat anything.
